required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Safety and Efficacy of MK-1293 Compared to Lantus™ in Participants With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) (MK-1293-003)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Clinical Trial to Study the Safety and Efficacy of MK-1293 Compared to Lantus™ in Subjects With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the safety and efficacy of MK-1293 to Lantus™ in participants with T1DM. The primary hypothesis is that after 24 weeks, the mean change in hemoglobin A1c (A1C) from baseline is non-inferior in participants treated with MK-1293 compared with participants treated with Lantus™.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (A1C) at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: A1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). This change from baseline reflects the Week 24 A1C minus the Week 0 A1C.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Any Confirmed Positive Anti-insulin Antibody (AIA) at Any Time Up Through Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with confirmed positive AIA at any time up through Week 24 including baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Negative AIA at Baseline Who Develop Confirmed Positive AIA at Any Time Up Through Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who became positive to AIA at or before Week 24, among participants who were AIA negative at baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in AIA Titer After 24 Weeks of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: This immunogenicity analysis will assess the effect of treatment with MK-1293 compared with Lantus on anti-insulin antibody development after 24 weeks of treatment. This change from baseline reflects the Week 24 AIA titer minus the Week 0 AIA titer.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Develop Insulin Neutralizing Antibodies Up Through Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants Who Develop Insulin Neutralizing Antibodies Up Through Week 24. This immunogenicity analysis assessed the effect of treatment with MK-1293 and with Lantus on insulin-neutralizing antibody (INab) development up through 24 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in A1C at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: A1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). This change from baseline reflects the Week 52 A1C minus the Week 0 A1C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Insulin Dose at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Total insulin dose = basal insulin (MK-1293 or Lantus) + bolus (prandial) insulin (non-study medication).

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Insulin Dose Per Kilogram (kg) of Body Weight (Unit/kg) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Total insulin dose = basal insulin (MK-1293 or Lantus) + bolus (prandial) insulin (non-study medication).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Blood glucose was measured on a fasting basis (collected after a 10-hour fast). FPG is expressed as mg/dL. This change from baseline reflects the FPG level at Week 24 minus the FPG level at Week 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Confirmed Positive AIA Up Through Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with confirmed positive AIA at any time up through Week 52 including baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Negative AIA at Baseline Who Develop Confirmed Positive AIA at Any Time Up Through Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who became positive to AIA at or before Week 52, among participants who were AIA negative at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in AIA Titer After 52 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: This immunogenicity analysis assessed the effect of treatment with MK-1293 compared with Lantus on anti-insulin antibody development after 52 weeks of treatment. This change from baseline reflects the AIA titers at Week 52 minus the AIA titers at Week 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Insulin Dose at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Total insulin dose = basal insulin (MK-1293 or Lantus) + bolus (prandial) insulin (non-study medication).

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Insulin Dose Per Kilogram (kg) of Body Weight (Unit/kg) at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Total insulin dose = basal insulin (MK-1293 or Lantus) + bolus (prandial) insulin (non-study medication).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FPG at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Blood glucose was measured on a fasting basis (collected after a 10-hour fast). This change from baseline reflects the FPG level at Week 52 minus the FPG level at Week 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Develop Insulin Neutralizing Antibodies Up Through Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants Who Develop Insulin Neutralizing Antibodies Up Thought Week 52. This immunogenicity analysis assessed the effect of treatment with MK-1293 and with Lantus on insulin-neutralizing antibody (INAb) development up through 52 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 7-point Self-monitored Blood Glucose (SMBG) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The 7-point SMBG profile consisted of the following measurements by glucose meter: morning pre-meal (fasting), 2 hours after morning meal, midday pre-meal, 2 hours after midday meal, evening pre meal, pre-bedtime (pre-dose and at least 2 hours after evening meal), between 2:00 AM and 4:00 AM in the morning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 7-point SMBG at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The 7-point SMBG profile consisted of the following measurements by glucose meter: morning pre-meal (fasting), 2 hours after morning meal, midday pre-meal, 2 hours after midday meal, evening pre meal, pre-bedtime (pre-dose and at least 2 hours after evening meal), between 2:00 AM and 4:00 AM in the morning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Attaining A1C Glycemic Goals of <7% and <6.5% After 24 Weeks of Treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants attaining A1C glycemic goals of <7.0% and <6.5% after 24 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Attaining A1C Glycemic Goals of <7% and <6.5% After 52 Weeks of Treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants attaining A1C glycemic goals of <7.0% and <6.5% after 52 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Basal Insulin Dose at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Basal Insulin Dose at Week 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Basal Insulin Dose Per kg of Body Weight at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Basal Insulin Dose per kg of Body Weight at Week 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bolus Insulin Dose at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Bolus Insulin Dose at Week 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bolus Insulin Dose Per kg of Body Weight at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Bolus Insulin Dose per kg of Body Weight at Week 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Basal Insulin Dose at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Basal Insulin Dose at Week 24.

secondary_outcome.measure: Basal Insulin Dose Per kg of Body Weight at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Basal Insulin Dose per kg of Body Weight at Week 24.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bolus Insulin Dose at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Bolus Insulin Dose at Week 24.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bolus Insulin Dose Per kg of Body Weight at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Bolus Insulin Dose per kg of Body Weight at Week 24.

arm_group.description: MK-1293 dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

Lantus dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

intervention.description: MK-1293 dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Initial dose will be determined based on the participant's previous insulin therapy. Thereafter, the dose will be titrated to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels. MK-1293 dosing once daily at times other than bedtime will be permitted for participants with a previously established dosing time.

Lantus™ dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Initial dose will be determined based on the participant's previous insulin therapy. Thereafter, the dose will be titrated to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels. Lantus™ dosing once daily at times other than bedtime will be permitted for participants with a previously established dosing time.
Participants will continue their prandial insulin during the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- T1DM For at least 1 year
- is currently using or has been using prandial insulin for at least 4 weeks. Participants taking any type of basal insulin should require a total daily dose of >=10 units/day. For participants currently taking pre-mixed insulin, the basal insulin component should be equivalent to a total daily dose of >=10 units/day.
- is male, or is female who is not of reproductive potential or if of reproductive potential agrees to remain abstinent or use (or have their partner use) an acceptable method of birth control during the study and for 14 days after the last dose of study medication
Exclusion Criteria:
- has had 1 or more severe hypoglycemic episodes associated with hypoglycemic seizure or loss of consciousness within the past 6 months
- history of ketoacidosis in the last 6 months
- participant, as assessed by the investigator, is not appropriate for or does not agree to target a fasting glucose of 70-100 mg/dL [3.9 -5.6 mmol/L].
- history of intolerance or hypersensitivity to Lantus™ or contraindication to Lantus™ or one of its excipients
- used a formulation of insulin glargine other than Lantus™
- has received injectable incretin-based therapy within the past 8 weeks
- on a weight loss program and not in the maintenance phase, or has started a weight loss medication within the past 8 weeks
- has undergone bariatric surgery within the past 12 months
- is likely to require treatment for 2 or more consecutive weeks or repeated courses of corticosteroids (note: inhaled, nasal, and topical corticosteroids are permitted)
- has undergone a surgical procedure within the past 4 weeks or has planned major surgery during the study
- has new or worsening signs or symptoms of coronary heart disease or congestive heart failure within the past 3 months, or has any following disorders within the past 3 months: acute coronary syndrome, coronary artery intervention, stroke or transient ischemic neurological disorder
- has severe peripheral vascular disease
- has high blood pressure
- has chronic myopathy, or a progressive neurological or neuromuscular disorder
- has active nephropathy
- history of active liver disease (other than non-alcoholic hepatic steatosis), including chronic active hepatitis B or C, primary biliary cirrhosis, or symptomatic gallbladder disease
- has human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)
- has a hematological disorder (such as aplastic anemia, myeloproliferative or myelodysplastic syndromes, thrombocytopenia)
- history of malignancy in the past 5 years, except for adequately treated basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer, or in situ cervical cancer
- history of melanoma, leukemia, lymphoma, or renal cell carcinoma
- is currently being treated for hyperthyroidism or has been on a stable dose of thyroid hormone replacement therapy for <6 weeks
- is a user of recreational or illicit drugs or has had a recent history of drug or alcohol abuse or dependence
- is pregnant or breast-feeding, or is expecting to conceive or donate eggs
- has donated blood products or has had phlebotomy of >300 mL within the past 8 weeks or intends to donate blood products during the study
- has poor mental function or works the night shift

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants at least 18 years of age who have had Type 1 diabetes mellitus (T1DM) for at least one year prior to study start.

group.title: MK-1293
group.description: MK-1293 dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

group.title: Lantus
group.description: Lantus dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

outcome.title: Primary: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (A1C) at Week 24
outcome.description: A1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). This change from baseline reflects the Week 24 A1C minus the Week 0 A1C.
outcome.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had at least one observation for the analysis endpoint.

measure.title: Primary: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (A1C) at Week 24
measure.description: A1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). This change from baseline reflects the Week 24 A1C minus the Week 0 A1C.
measure.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had at least one observation for the analysis endpoint.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The criterion for declaring non-inferiority was for the upper bound of the 95% CI to lie below 0.4%.
analysis.param_type: Difference in the Least Squares Means
analysis.estimate_desc: Longitudinal data analysis model included terms for treatment, time, prior insulin status (intermediate-acting, or long-acting insulin), and the interaction of time by treatment, and time by prior insulin status.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Any Confirmed Positive Anti-insulin Antibody (AIA) at Any Time Up Through Week 24
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with confirmed positive AIA at any time up through Week 24 including baseline.
outcome.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had data for AIA at or before Week 24.

group.title: MK-1293
group.description: MK-1293 dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Any Confirmed Positive Anti-insulin Antibody (AIA) at Any Time Up Through Week 24
measure.description: Percentage of participants with confirmed positive AIA at any time up through Week 24 including baseline.
measure.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had data for AIA at or before Week 24.

analysis.param_type: Difference in the Percentages
analysis.estimate_desc: Miettinen & Nurminen

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Negative AIA at Baseline Who Develop Confirmed Positive AIA at Any Time Up Through Week 24
outcome.description: Percentage of participants who became positive to AIA at or before Week 24, among participants who were AIA negative at baseline.
outcome.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who were AIA negative at baseline and had data for AIA at or before Week 24.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in AIA Titer After 52 Weeks of Treatment
measure.description: This immunogenicity analysis assessed the effect of treatment with MK-1293 compared with Lantus on anti-insulin antibody development after 52 weeks of treatment. This change from baseline reflects the AIA titers at Week 52 minus the AIA titers at Week 0.
measure.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had AIA data at baseline and Week 52.

outcome.title: Total Insulin Dose at Week 52
outcome.description: Total insulin dose = basal insulin (MK-1293 or Lantus) + bolus (prandial) insulin (non-study medication).
outcome.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had at least one observation for the analysis endpoint.

group.title: MK-1293
group.description: MK-1293 dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

group.title: Lantus
group.description: Lantus dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

measure.title: Total Insulin Dose at Week 52
measure.description: Total insulin dose = basal insulin (MK-1293 or Lantus) + bolus (prandial) insulin (non-study medication).
measure.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had at least one observation for the analysis endpoint.

analysis.param_type: Difference in the least squares means
analysis.estimate_desc: Longitudinal data analysis model included terms for treatment, time, prior insulin status (intermediate-acting, or long-acting insulin), and the interaction of time by treatment, and time by prior insulin status.

outcome.title: Total Insulin Dose Per Kilogram (kg) of Body Weight (Unit/kg) at Week 52
outcome.description: Total insulin dose = basal insulin (MK-1293 or Lantus) + bolus (prandial) insulin (non-study medication).
outcome.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had at least one observation for the analysis endpoint.

measure.title: Total Insulin Dose Per Kilogram (kg) of Body Weight (Unit/kg) at Week 52
measure.description: Total insulin dose = basal insulin (MK-1293 or Lantus) + bolus (prandial) insulin (non-study medication).

analysis.param_type: Difference in the least squares means
analysis.estimate_desc: Longitudinal data analysis model included terms for treatment, time, prior insulin status (intermediate-acting, or long-acting insulin), and the interaction of time by treatment, and time by prior insulin status.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in FPG at Week 52
outcome.description: Blood glucose was measured on a fasting basis (collected after a 10-hour fast). This change from baseline reflects the FPG level at Week 52 minus the FPG level at Week 0.
outcome.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had at least one observation for the analysis endpoint.

group.title: MK-1293
group.description: MK-1293 dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

group.title: Lantus
group.description: Lantus dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in FPG at Week 52
measure.description: Blood glucose was measured on a fasting basis (collected after a 10-hour fast). This change from baseline reflects the FPG level at Week 52 minus the FPG level at Week 0.
measure.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had at least one observation for the analysis endpoint.

analysis.param_type: Difference in the Least Squares Means
analysis.estimate_desc: Longitudinal data analysis including terms for treatment, time, prior insulin status (intermediate-acting, or long-acting insulin), and the interaction of time by treatment, and time by prior insulin status.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Develop Insulin Neutralizing Antibodies Up Through Week 52
outcome.description: Percentage of Participants Who Develop Insulin Neutralizing Antibodies Up Thought Week 52. This immunogenicity analysis assessed the effect of treatment with MK-1293 and with Lantus on insulin-neutralizing antibody (INAb) development up through 52 weeks of treatment.
outcome.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who were INAb negative at baseline and who had data for INAb at or before Week 52.

group.title: MK-1293
group.description: MK-1293 dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

group.title: Lantus
group.description: Lantus dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Develop Insulin Neutralizing Antibodies Up Through Week 52
measure.description: Percentage of Participants Who Develop Insulin Neutralizing Antibodies Up Thought Week 52. This immunogenicity analysis assessed the effect of treatment with MK-1293 and with Lantus on insulin-neutralizing antibody (INAb) development up through 52 weeks of treatment.
measure.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who were INAb negative at baseline and who had data for INAb at or before Week 52.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in 7-point Self-monitored Blood Glucose (SMBG) at Week 24
outcome.description: The 7-point SMBG profile consisted of the following measurements by glucose meter: morning pre-meal (fasting), 2 hours after morning meal, midday pre-meal, 2 hours after midday meal, evening pre meal, pre-bedtime (pre-dose and at least 2 hours after evening meal), between 2:00 AM and 4:00 AM in the morning.
outcome.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had at least one observation for the analysis endpoint.

group.title: MK-1293
group.description: MK-1293 dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

measure.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants who had at least one observation for the analysis endpoint.

analysis.estimate_desc: Longitudinal data analysis model including terms for treatment, time, prior insulin status (intermediate-acting, or long-acting insulin), and the interaction of time by treatment, and time by prior insulin status.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Attaining A1C Glycemic Goals of <7% and <6.5% After 24 Weeks of Treatment.
outcome.description: Percentage of participants attaining A1C glycemic goals of <7.0% and <6.5% after 24 weeks of treatment.
outcome.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants with a Week 24 A1C measurement.

group.title: MK-1293
group.description: MK-1293 dosed subcutaneously once daily at bedtime for 52 weeks. Doses were individually titrated post-randomization to the suggested target for fasting fingerstick glucose levels of >70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) and ≤100 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Attaining A1C Glycemic Goals of <7% and <6.5% After 24 Weeks of Treatment.
measure.description: Percentage of participants attaining A1C glycemic goals of <7.0% and <6.5% after 24 weeks of treatment.
measure.population: The analysis population included all randomized, treated participants with a Week 24 A1C measurement.

analysis.param_type: Adjusted Difference in %s (A1C < 7.0%)
analysis.estimate_desc: Miettinen and Nurminen, stratified by prior insulin status.

analysis.param_type: Adjusted Difference in %s (A1C <6.5%)
analysis.estimate_desc: Miettinen and Nurminen, stratified by prior insulin status.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/ presentation. Any information identified by the sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
